output module¶

This module contains functions for downloading, processing, and updating CSR reports data.

output.call_deepseek_api(text)[source]¶

Calls the DeepSeek API to extract Scope 1, 2, 3 emissions and Water Consumption from a text.

Parameters:

text (str) – The text content to be analyzed.

Returns:

The JSON response from the API, or None if the call failed.

Return type:

str or None

output.download_pdf(url, symbol, year)[source]¶

Downloads a PDF file using either requests or Selenium.

Parameters:

  • url (str) – The URL of the PDF file to download.

  • symbol (str) – The symbol associated with the report.

  • year (int) – The year of the report.

Returns:

The path where the PDF file was saved, or None if the download failed.

Return type:

str or None

output.fetch_reports_from_db()[source]¶

Fetches reports from the database that need to be processed.

Returns:

A list of tuples containing symbol, report_url, and report_year.

Return type:

list

output.main()[source]¶

The main entry point for the script. Fetches reports from the database, processes them, and updates the database.

output.process_single_download(row)[source]¶

Processes a single report download, extraction, and database update.

Parameters:

row (tuple) – A tuple containing symbol, report_url, and report_year.

output.resolve_real_symbol(symbol, year)[source]¶

Resolves the real symbol for a given symbol and year.

Parameters:

  • symbol (str) – The symbol to resolve.

  • year (int) – The year of the report.

Returns:

The resolved symbol, or None if not found.

Return type:

str or None

output.try_requests_download(url, path)[source]¶

Attempts to download a PDF file using the requests library.

Parameters:

  • url (str) – The URL of the PDF file to download.

  • path (str) – The local path where the PDF file will be saved.

Returns:

True if the download was successful, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

output.try_selenium_download(url, path)[source]¶

Attempts to download a PDF file using Selenium.

Parameters:

  • url (str) – The URL of the PDF file to download.

  • path (str) – The local path where the PDF file will be saved.

Returns:

True if the download was successful, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

output.update_database(symbol, year, scope_1, scope_2, scope_3, water_consumption)[source]¶

Updates the database with the extracted emissions and water consumption data.

Parameters:

  • symbol (str) – The symbol associated with the report.

  • year (int) – The year of the report.

  • scope_1 (float or None) – The Scope 1 emissions.

  • scope_2 (float or None) – The Scope 2 emissions.

  • scope_3 (float or None) – The Scope 3 emissions.

  • water_consumption (float or None) – The water consumption.

cw2
